metadata.title: CVE-2017-5029 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The xsltAddTextString function in transform.c in libxslt 1.1.29, as used inBlink in Google Chrome prior to 57.0.2987.98 for Mac, Windows, and Linuxand 57.0.2987.108 for Android, lacked a check for integer overflow during asize calculation, which allowed a remote attacker to perform an out ofbounds memory write via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5029` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276
chromium-browser-l10n - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276
chromium-chromedriver - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.21.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.21.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.21.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.21.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.21.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

libxslt1.1 - 1.1.28-2.1ubuntu0.1
python-libxslt1 - 1.1.28-2.1ubuntu0.1
xsltproc - 1.1.28-2.1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.21.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
libxslt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.28-2.1ubuntu0.1').
